messages.message: Do we support password vault feature on the platform? The use case is to store passwords/tokens/certs to make api connection with external systems.
What is the recommended way to store these data on platform ?
what is the use case/what are they trying to store to make a connection for

This is for JPMC's custody fax use case.

IB solution needs to send final results to two Jpmc systems (GDT and GCSW) via an API.

It's a secure connection between Instabase and these systems. So we need to pass access tokens/certs while making an API call.

The Jpmc platform team doesn't want us to store these tokens in a config/hardcode in file. This is a risk. So they are checking with us what is the secured way to store this on our platform. 

Aa per them, these should be store in password vault. Unfortunately we don't have it.

for this type of info, they could create k8s secrets and mount certs into the app-task pod? Yea we havenâ€™t built any system for storing secrets ourselves yet. SC has asked for this a long time ago, but it was low pri. Will definitely add this to the feature request list!
+1 many customers ask about this feature
How can we raise this for consideration on the product roadmap?

please let me know where can I create this request?

Also, Is there any documentation on creating k8s secrets and mounting certs into app-task pod?
If I understand correctly, we can access them from UDFs right?

I filed a Jira here (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/CS-872) to track interest. We can surface this feature request in Q4 planning to see if it aligns with top priorities and bandwidth allows for it.
If you ask the customers platform team who manages the deployment, they will know how to create secrets and mount certs in their infra. and yes, they can then use from UDFs.
